reviewText: Maybe I missed something... but I didn't think it was household knowledge to know that "Region 2" in brackets meant it was formatted for machinery in other countries and would not work in America. Very stupid and frustrating, took forever to come because of international customs, and then I can't even use it. I figured there had to be more sellers that sold the 2 for 1 series of Home Alone but there aren't... and I didn't think it was possible that the only seller of an AMERICAN Xmas Classic would be for a completely different country. Highly disappointed and I can't even return it without spending way more than I spent buying it. Complete waste. I wish it would have been more clearly stated what formatting policies are and what exactly any of that junk means for Regions.... I don't even know why that crap exists in 2013.
summary: Don't buy this is you live in America

reviewText: When the action hits its climax, this treads a dangerous line between cartoon violence and the real thing, but a powerful dose of John Hughes sentimentality and a side of Christmas spirit mostly smooth things over. Macaulay Culkin's acting in the lead is utterly unbearable for anyone over the age of ten, and the cache of gimmicks and booby traps that fuel his story often asks far too much of the audience. Joe Pesci and Daniel Stern make up for that as a duo of over-amplified burglar stereotypes, played with a wink and a nudge at just the right moments, and Catherine O'Hara shines in a rare straight role as the flustered mother an ocean away from her youngest child. Straightforward and light for the majority of its run time, the film works best when it remembers to pluck the heartstrings with a few season-specific character moments and subplots.
summary: Fluffy Holiday Mayhem With a Warm Heart
Title: N/A

reviewText: I hadn't seen this movie in years, but it's still hilarious. Home Alone is one of those classic comedies that will manage to make you laugh despite yourself. In fact, I'm surprised at how well it has worn the test of time. The movie is filled with great scenes and impeccable timing, sometimes approaching slapstick routines. The humor is good natured, but doesn't shy away from some curse words. Of course, Macaulay Culkin makes it all possible with his adorable acting and wisecracks ("I'm 10 years old, TV's my life"). Most people have probably already seen the first two Home Alone movies. If you have, I invite you to watch them again whenever you feel nostalgic (especially in light of the fact that Hollywood can't make good comedies anymore). If you haven't seen it yet, you're in for a treat.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Okay, so the Home Alone (1 & 2) movies aren't old enough yet to be long-term classical holiday movies, but the content and style of this collection is still terrific and great entertainment value for kids and now grandkids.  My kids saw it when it first came out around Thanksgiving, 1990, and they and now their kids still laugh alot when they see the movie around the holiday season.  The Blu-ray collection is well worth the value plus the added depth of blu-ray on a HDTV is spectacular.  The sound is cleaner than the original VHS tape / DVD collection of past years.  The enlargement in hi-def looks great and depth of field is terrific as colors and items in the background now appear cleaner and brighter.  The additional materials included with each disc are the same as with earlier DVDs.  If you are thinking of upgrading to blu-ray and want a fine collection to add to your holiday must-see videos, this is one great set of movies for entertainment.  Skip the Home Alone 3 and other versions as they're not worth the two original John Hughes directed/produced films.
summary: Terrific Holiday Movie That's Now A Classic

reviewText: It is a Thanksgiving tradition in my house to watch "Home Alone" as the dinner is being prepared.  (My kitchen T.V. has a built in DVD player.)  We all recite together "Take that, you filthy animal!" I always cringe at the same parts where the robbers fall into Kevin's traps.  The next day, we watch "Home Alone 2" and relax. It's a lot of work preparing and cleaning up Thanksgiving dinner!These movies are considered holiday classics in our home.  ("Home Alone 3" isn't even worth considering.)  These two movies represent that rare combination of the sequel being just as good as the original.
summary: Can't have one without the other

reviewText: In "Home Alone", 8 year old Kevin McCallister (Macully Culkin) has been accidentally left behind while his family is in Paris for Christmas vacation, he has the whole house for himself to enjoy as he can eat whatever he wants, watch whatever movie he wants to see on video and all that including getting his very own cheese pizza but later on he realizes he misses his family after he thought he made them disappear, somehow two criminals named Marv and Harry (Daniel Stern and Joe Pesci) are out robbing houses it's up to Kevin to defend his home. In "Home Alone 2" Kevin's family is heading to Florida as he accidentally is separated from his family once again when he takes the wrong flight which takes him straight to New York as he has one of his father's credit cards plus some cash as well as he finds shelter and food at a hotel, however the Wet Bandits have escaped from prison as they are using New York as their place for a special holiday heist, Kevin meets them again and has to defend himself once again from Marv and Harry.2 quality Christmas comedies from writer-producer John Hughes and directed by Chris Columbus, these became smash hit sensations for Fox back in 1990 and 1992 as in fact part 1 became 1990's biggest smash hit surprisingly an a Christmas favorite with some audiences like myself as i remembered seeing both movies 5 times in theaters as a kid. The movies star Catherine O'Hara, John Heard, Tim Curry, Maggie Smith, Rob Schneider, Eddie Bracken and John Candy as these films are heartwarming, hilarious and enjoyable holiday hits for everyone to enjoy.These blu-rays offer quality picture and sound with nice extras on the first movie and only a theatrical trailer for the second movie.
summary: high def double feature of 2 great holiday comedies

reviewText: So, they're a Christmas classic anymore and probably Macaulay Culkin's big claim to fame... Unlike Leonardo DiCaprio, who tooke a little time off but came back to star in some reasonably decent fare after Gilbert Grape & Titanic.Anyway, this collection has the two Culkin flicks before they bastardized the series. Both these look / sound good to me. Though I don't have surround sound and didn't much scrutinize for grain. I'd guess there probably is some if you go looking for it. I try not to 'cause it's hard not to see grain when you stand right up close to a 60" TV. ;) From normal viewing distance, everything looked great to me. A good set, overall! And there are a few extra features to round out the set.Who wouldn't want to watch these around the holidays? They're just nice mindless holiday fun. Sure, they're ridiculous and completely unbelievable. But it was, what, the 80's? 90's? Everything was ridiculous and unbelievable back then.The Goonies,Hook,Jumanji. I rest my case... ^_^
summary: The two Macaulay Culkin Home Alone movies. What more do you need?

reviewText: Dont get me wrong. This is a great movie, and the second one is great too. But these transfers to DVD's are complete rip offs! Where are the bonus features?????They may come with trailers, full screen, and subtitles.... but I was very disapointed when these came out on DVD and had nothing else included on them. And I know the stuff exsists! I remember very clearly watching a behind the scenes featurette on home alone, and home alone 2 when they where about to be released. I remember Daniles talkin about how he was the guy in charge of whats funny, and i remember them talking about how it wasnt filmed at christmas and they had fake snow, and fake pigeons ect.... WHERE ARE THOSE FEATURES?????To a person who dosent care about bonus features. Then go ahead and buy these great movies. But for someone like me who does want things like that, espesicly for such a huge comedy smash hit like these 2 movies, youd expect more wouldnt you? Even Audio comentary would be nice? Why is this blockbuster sucses treated so poorly on the DVD release? ITS NOT EVEN IN SURROUND SOUND!!!!!!!!!! (5.1)I hope they release a better special edition of these films with features worth buying, to replace the old VHS copys most of us have. Untill then, keep your videos, the dvd's arnt worth getting yet

reviewText: First and foremost if you already have the previous released dvd sets for these two movies go ahead and keep those but buy this newest release as the video and audio quality are far clearer and more detailed that make it very worth getting this product.  The other part I'm glad they did is just kept these first two Home Alone movies together and didn't add the less then stellar sequels that followed afterwords. For obvious reasons the three cast that will stay with you and what made these two movies so wonderful to watch over and over are Macaulay Culkin as Kevin McCallister the rascal who is left by himself on two X-mas holidays and after having some fun without adult supervision begins a game of wits with two bumbling thieves Joe Pesci and Daniel Stern and the hilarity and hijinx that follows still leave you laughing. That is probably what makes the first two Home Alone movies the best of the series and it became somewhat sad when they tried to make this a cash cow with less then a talented and endearing cast it shows and the last two movies that followed.  So for fans of hilarious holiday movies here's a great one to add to your home library and watch again and again for an enjoyable time and a good laugh....
summary: An Iconic X-Mas Movie Re-Released On The Best Format Yet

reviewText: I just picked up this set from a local brick and mortar chain.  I see a lot of negative opinions about Home Alone 2 in particular.  Some reviewers have even said that their old DVD copy looks better than the blu-ray.  I watched it last night and found no problems with the picture quality whatsoever.  I noticed a vast improvement in the detail over my old DVD copy.  But I don't know if I got a newer set or what, but the product I purchased has different artwork on the carboard sleeve as well as the the individual inserts for the disc cases.  Also they have a 2013 release date on them.  I can't find pictures of a set with the same artwork anywhere except on an import copy, but that artwork has english and foreign language print on it, mine only has english.  So I don't know if I've gotten newly released and remastered discs or this is the same set with new artwork.  But it's odd I can't find any pictures of a US release with this artwork on it anywhere.  I might upload some pics later.  For now I will upload the pic I found of the import.EDIT 11/14/13 - I see Amazon has added a photo for the updated art on the slipcover.  Anybody else get the ones with the new artwork?
summary: No problems found, but did I get something different?

reviewText: The first one was superior to the second one in every way! In the second one the location is different, but the the plot is the same with little change. I found that the lead character was badly directed and because of this was allowed to overact and, except for some good places-not many- he did not come across with the same charm that he had in the first one. If you have the first one keep it and pass up the second one. If I had known how bad the second one was I would not have bought them as a combination!

reviewText: If you or somebody you know loves Home Alone and Home Alone 2: Lost in New York, and doesn't want the both movies buy themselves, this is something to get. But this is not the only 2 pack for movies on dvd, Toy Story and Toy Story 2, 101 and 102 Dalmatians, are also movies that are in 2 packs. In the first Home Alone, young Kevn McCallister (Macaualy Culkin) is angry with his large family, and wishes his whole family to disappear, the McCallisters have a trip to Paris coming up, the next day. But the every member of the family sleeps in because of a power problems during the night. And when they wake up, they have to do a lot of running around getting ready. But they forget one thing, they leave Kevin McCallister behind. And Kevin is happy when he wakes up and doesn't see his family around.Okay Home Alone 2: Lost in New York, Macaulay Culkin is back as Kevin McCallister, but once again his family makes him angry, when there is trouble in a christmas pagent. And this time the McCallisters are going to Miami, and Kevin wishes that this time if he had his own money he own money he'll on his own vaction. There are once again power problems and the McCallisters are rushing around again, and they head off for the airport, and this time Kevin is wake and is at the airport, but his family is running to fast, Kevin loses his passport, and gets on hte flight with his family (or so he thinks), but he really boared a plane for New York. Looks like to me, Kevin has got his wish again to me. Other characters in both films include Harry (Joe Pesic), Marv (Daniel Stern), Kevin's mother (Catherine O'Hara), Kevin's dad (John Heard), Kevin's bother Buzz (Devin Ratray) and Kevin's grumpy uncle Frank (Gerry Bamman)

reviewText: I will go ahead and say that I love the very first "Home Alone" movie.  The second movie.... um.... just a little.  I grew up watching movies and this was one of the many that I did watch.I really love the first film.  It was creative.  It was funny.  It was adventure-packed.  And it was just something kids loved to see.  Heck, it even had the Christmas spirit in it as well.  For the second movie, I was a little disappointed.  It didn't really offer anything new and it didn't give us the same formula like from the first film.  But it was an okay movie.Kids would love to watch something like this.  It has everything they dream of doing and it delivers the laughs that we all love.  Highly recommended!
summary: A double movie that kids will love to death!

reviewText: Okay, so classic may not yet be the right word, perhaps it is too early to term these as such, but they are favorites from my childhood. Home Alone 1 nailed it, Home Alone 2 was slightly more outrageous and unbelievable in regards to the punishment Harry and Marv withstand, but I still love it. If you are a movie collector and don't have these, you need to add them to your collection.
